verses.verse: A false<WH4820> balance<WH3976> is an abomination<WH8441> to the Lord,<WH3068> But a just<WH8003> weight<WH68> is His delight.<WH7522>
When pride<WH2087> comes,<WH935> then comes<WH935> dishonor,<WH7036> But with the humble<WH9492> is wisdom.<WH2451>
The integrity<WH8538> of the upright<WH3477> will guide<WH5148> them, But the falseness<WH5558> of the treacherous<WH898> will destroy<WH7703> them.
Riches<WH1952> do not profit<WH3276> in the day<WH3117> of wrath,<WH5678> But righteousness<WH6666> delivers<WH5337> from death.<WH4194>
The righteousness<WH6666> of the blameless<WH8549> will smooth<WH3474> his way,<WH1870> But the wicked<WH7563> will fall<WH5307> by his own wickedness.<WH7564>
The righteousness<WH6666> of the upright<WH3477> will deliver<WH5337> them, But the treacherous<WH898> will be caught<WH3920> by [their own] greed.<WH1942>
When a wicked<WH7563> man<WH120> dies,<WH4194> [his] expectation<WH8615> will perish, And the hope<WH6> of strong<WH8431> men<WH202> perishes.
The righteous<WH6662> is delivered<WH2502> from trouble,<WH6869> But the wicked<WH7563> takes<WH935> his place.<WH8478>
With [his] mouth<WH6310> the godless<WH2611> man<WH2611> destroys<WH7843> his neighbor,<WH7453> But through knowledge<WH1847> the righteous<WH6662> will be delivered.<WH2502>
When it goes well<WH2898> with the righteous,<WH6662> the city<WH7151> rejoices,<WH5970> And when the wicked<WH7563> perish, there is glad<WH6> shouting.<WH7440>
By the blessing<WH1293> of the upright<WH3477> a city<WH7176> is exalted,<WH7311> But by the mouth<WH6310> of the wicked<WH7563> it is torn<WH2040> down.<WH2040>
He who despises<WH936> his neighbor<WH7453> lacks<WH2638> sense,<WH3820> But a man<WH376> of understanding<WH8394> keeps<WH2790> silent.<WH2790>
He who goes<WH1980> about as a talebearer<WH7400> reveals<WH1540> secrets,<WH5475> But he who is trustworthy<WH539> <WH7307> conceals<WH3680> a matter.<WH1697>
Where there<WH369> is no<WH369> guidance,<WH8458> the people<WH5971> fall,<WH5307> But in abundance<WH7230> of counselors<WH3289> there is victory.<WH8668>
He who is surety<WH6148> for a stranger<WH2114> will surely<WH9563> suffer<WH7489> for it, But he who hates<WH8130> going<WH8628> surety<WH8628> is safe.<WH982>
A gracious<WH2580> woman<WH802> attains<WH8551> honor,<WH9202> And violent<WH6184> men<WH6184> attain<WH8551> riches.<WH6239>
The merciful<WH2617> man<WH376> does<WH1580> himself<WH5315> good,<WH2617> But the cruel<WH394> man<WH394> does<WH5916> himself<WH7607> harm.<WH5916>
The wicked<WH7563> earns<WH6213> deceptive<WH8267> wages,<WH7938> But he who sows<WH2232> righteousness<WH6666> [gets] a true<WH571> reward.<WH7938>
He who<WH9210> is steadfast<WH9210> in righteousness<WH6666> [will attain] to life,<WH9132> And he who pursues<WH7291> evil<WH9567> [will bring about] his own death.<WH4194>
The perverse<WH6141> in heart<WH3820> are an abomination<WH8441> to the Lord,<WH3068> But the blameless<WH8549> in [their] walk<WH1870> are His delight.<WH7522>
Assuredly,<WH3027> the evil<WH7451> man<WH7451> will not go<WH5352> unpunished,<WH5352> But the descendants<WH2233> of the righteous<WH6662> will be delivered.<WH4422>
[As] a ring<WH5141> of gold<WH2091> in a swine's snout,<WH639> [So is] a beautiful<WH3303> woman<WH802> who lacks<WH5493> discretion.<WH2940>
The desire<WH8378> of the righteous<WH6662> is only<WH389> good,<WH9185> [But] the expectation<WH8615> of the wicked<WH7563> is wrath.<WH5678>

There<WH3426> is one who scatters,<WH6340> yet increases<WH3254> all<WH5750> the more,<WH5750> And there is one who withholds<WH2820> what<WH3476> is justly<WH3476> due,<WH3476> but [it results] only<WH389> in want.<WH4270>
The generous<WH1293> man<WH5315> will be prosperous,<WH1878> And he who waters<WH7301> will himself<WH1931> be watered.<WH9196>
He who withholds<WH4513> grain,<WH1250> the people<WH3816> will curse<WH6895> him, But blessing<WH1293> will be on the head<WH7218> of him who sells<WH7666> [it.]
He who diligently<WH7836> seeks<WH7836> good<WH9185> seeks<WH1245> favor,<WH7522> But he who searches<WH1875> after evil,<WH9567> it will come<WH935> to him.
He who trusts<WH982> in his riches<WH6239> will fall,<WH5307> But the righteous<WH6662> will flourish<WH6524> like the [green] leaf.<WH5929>
He who troubles<WH5916> his own house<WH1004> will inherit<WH5157> wind,<WH7307> And the foolish<WH191> will be servant<WH5650> to the wisehearted.<WH2450>
The fruit<WH6529> of the righteous<WH6662> is a tree<WH6086> of life,<WH9132> And he who is wise<WH2450> wins<WH3947> souls.<WH5315>
If<WH2005> the righteous<WH6662> will be rewarded<WH9608> in the earth,<WH776> How<WH637> much<WH637> <WH3588> more<WH637> the wicked<WH7563> and the sinner!<WH2398>
